comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: As well as making practical inventions, such as the spark plug, he studied telepathy and psychic phenomena. He was in the news around 1913 because he was giving speeches about his belief that personality survived after death and expected that a clear demonstration was close. For example, see NYT of 9/10/1913 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F01E0DB123FE633A...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: It was a challenge I couldn't resist, so I decided to put Lodge's immortality theory to the test this very morning. Imagine my astonishment when I was able to hold a telepathic conversation with him that lasted nearly thirty minutes! (He asked me not to reveal the details.)
